title: Special attention drawn to challenges faced in resuming projects that were halted due to economic crisis
byline: Special attention of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake and officials has been drawn to the challenges faced in resuming projects that were halted due to the recent economic crisis as well as in sustaining on-going projects.

title: First human case of flesh-eating screwworm parasite confirmed in US
byline: The first human case of a flesh-eating parasite infestation has been confirmed in the US, authorities say.

title: Donald Trump says likely to visit China this year or soon after
byline: US President Donald Trump said Monday (Aug 25) that he expects to visit China this year or shortly afterwards, noting that economic ties between the two countries have improved - even as he kept the door open to steeper tariffs.

title: Large crowd to converge in Colombo today?
byline: All opposition parties have decided to gather in Colombo today setting aside political and party differences to express solidarity with former President Ranil Wickremesinghe who is currently in remand custody, Assistant Leader of the UNP former Minister Akila Viraj Kariyawasam stated.

title: Case against ex-President Ranil to be taken up in court today
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, who became the first Executive President of Sri Lanka to be arrested and remanded, is scheduled to be produced before the Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court today.

title: Youth arrested over Boralesgamuwa fatal shooting
byline: An individual involved in a fatal shooting and the injuring of another person in Boralesgamuwa has been arrested by a team of officers from the Moratuwa camp of the Police Special Task Force, along with a quantity of heroin, police stated.

title: Shooting incident reported in Matara
byline: A shooting incident has been reported last night (25) in Matara, police stated.

title: Showers expected in few areas of the country today
byline: Showers or thundershowers may occur at a few places in Uva province and in Ampara and Batticaloa district after 2.00 p.m.

title: University entrance cut-off marks released
byline: University entrance cut-off marks for the candidates of 2024/25 GCE Advanced Level Examination have been released by the University Grants Commission (UGC).

title: Ex-President Ranil unlikely to be produced in court today - Prisons Spokesman
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, who is currently under observation at the Intensive Care Unit (ICU) of the National Hospital in Colombo, is unlikely to be produced in person before court today owing to his health condition, said Prisons Spokesman.

title: Another 619 individuals nabbed during special island-wide police raids
byline: A total of 619 individuals have been arrested on suspicion of being involved in criminal activities and also over illicit liquor and drug-related offenses during a special island-wide operation conducted yesterday.

title: Security beefed up near Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court premises
byline: Security has been beefed up adjacent to the Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court premises, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Gazan students granted approval to study in UK
byline: The British government has agreed plans to allow around 40 students in Gaza to come to the UK in the coming weeks to take up funded university scholarships.

title: Elon Musk’s xAI sues Apple and OpenAI over AI competition, App Store rankings
byline: Billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence startup xAI sued Apple (AAPL.O), opens new tab and ChatGPT maker OpenAI in U.S. federal court in Texas on Monday, accusing them of illegally conspiring to thwart competition for artificial intelligence.

title: Seevali Arukgoda named new Director General of Sri Lanka Customs
byline: Additional Director General of Sri Lanka Customs Seevali Arukgoda has been appointed as the new Director General, effective today (26).

title: Case against ex-Minister Harin Fernando postponed until January
byline: The case filed against former Minister Harin Fernando, in relation to the alleged election law violations has been postponed until January 6, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Former State Minister Shasheendra Rajapaksa further remanded
byline: Former State Minister Shasheendra Rajapaksa, who was arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) has been further remanded until August 29, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Ambani son’s wildlife park to face court probe into allegations of animal mistreatment
byline: India’s Supreme Court has ordered an investigation into a wildlife rescue park run by Reliance Foundation, the philanthropic arm of billionaire Mukesh Ambani’s group, although it said allegations of unlawful animal acquisitions and mistreatment were not supported by evidence.

title: Two police officers killed and one injured in shooting in Victoria, Australia
byline: Two police officers have been killed and another injured in a shooting at a rural property in Porepunkah in north-east Victoria, Australia.

title: Unified bus timetable introduced for long-distance buses operating from Colombo
byline: The National Transport Commission (NTC) announced that the unified bus timetable service for both Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) and private buses commenced at midnight yesterday (25) from the Bastian Mawatha Bus Terminal in Colombo.

title: 1 in 4 people lack access to safe drinking water: UN
byline: More than two billion people worldwide still lack access to safely-managed drinking water, the United Nations said on Tuesday, warning that progress towards universal coverage was moving nowhere near quickly enough.

title: UNP seniors call on Chief Prelate of Asgiriya Chapter
byline: A delegation of senior members and leaders of the United National Party (UNP) visited the Asgiriya Maha Viharaya this morning (26) and received blessings from the Chief Prelate of the Asgiriya Chapter, Most Venerable Warakagoda Sri Gnanarathana Thero.

title: Tourist arrivals in August top 166,000
byline: A total of 166,766 tourists have arrived in the country thus far in August, data from the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority shows.

title: Special Security at Colombo National Hospital
byline: Security has been beefed up at the Colombo National Hospital and surrounding areas from this morning (26), Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Ex-President Ranil Wickremesinghe granted bail
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, who was arrested and remanded on Friday (22), has been granted bail, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Heavy traffic congestion in Colombo 2, Opposition protest march “Against Repression” underway
byline: Heavy traffic congestion has been reported along several roads near the Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court premises as opposition has commenced a protest march themed “Against Repression”.

title: Panel of lawyers for Ranil – Attorney General’s Department opposes granting bail
byline: The case filed against former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, who is currently in remand custody under the Public Property Act, has been taken up before the Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court.

title: Ex-President Ranil joins court hearing via Zoom, full medical report submitted by attorneys
byline: The hearing of the case filed against Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe is currently underway at the Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court.

title: Former Deputy Director of Prison Hospital granted bail
byline: Former Deputy Director of the Prison Hospital, Dr. Hemantha Ranasinghe who was arrested on bribery charges and subsequently remanded, has been granted bail, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Hearing of case against ex-President Ranil underway at Fort Magistrate’s Court
byline: The hearing of the case filed against former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, who was arrested and remanded over the alleged misuse of state funds, commenced at the Colombo Fort Magistrate”s Court, a short while ago, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Police officer sustains injuries during protest organized by opposition
byline: A police officer has sustained injuries during a protest organized by the opposition in Colombo, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Road opposite Colombo University blocked due to IUSF protest
byline: The road adjacent to the University of Colombo has been closed due to a protest organized by the Inter-University Student Federation (IUSF).

title: PM Harini denies visiting Ex-President Ranil in hospital
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has dismissed reports claiming that she visited former President Ranil Wickremesinghe who is currently receiving treatment at the Intensive Care Unit(ICU) of the Colombo National Hospital. She challenged anyone who has evidence to the contrary to come forward and present them.

title: Ex-President Ranil has not been produced in court for hearing – Officials
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe has not been produced in court for the hearing of the case filed under the Public Property Act.

title: UNP leaders express gratitude for support of former President Ranil
byline: United National Party (UNP) Assistant Leader and former minister Akila Viraj Kariyawasam expressed his gratitude on behalf of the UNP to everyone who worked tirelessly during the period following the arrest of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe.

title: British HC denies claims of High Commissioner’s presence at Ranil’s court hearing
byline: The British High Commission in Colombo has denied reports claiming that British High Commissioner Andrew Patrick attended the court hearing of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe today (August 26).

title: Case against ex-President Ranil to be heard in October
byline: The case filed against former President Ranil Wickremesinghe over the alleged misuse of state funds will be taken up again on October 29.

title: Ex-President Ranil to remain in hospital for few days
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, who was granted bail by the Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court today (26), will remain at the Colombo National Hospital for a few more days to continue receiving treatment, according to his office.

title: Aswesuma: August allowance for elders to be credited to bank accounts tomorrow
byline: The monthly allowance designated for elderly individuals aged over 70, enrolled in the ‘Aswesuma’ welfare benefit program, will be credited to their respective bank accounts tomorrow (27), the Welfare Benefits Board has announced.

title: Not revenge or political witch-hunt, everyone is equal before the law – President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake stated that his government is committed to establishing a culture where everyone is treated equally before the law.
